author: Special Correspondent
text:
The CB-CID has filed case against 12 persons, including two senior police officers, in connection with the killing of a criminal, S. Kittappa (34), in an encounter near here on June 13, 2015.

Following a direction from the court, the CB-CID registered the case against G.S. Madhavan, Assistant Commissioner of Police, Palayamkottai, Rajaram, DSP, Thaazhaiyooththu, Inspector Krishnaraj, Sub-Inspector Sivaramakrishnan, policemen Saravana Sundar and Krishnasamy and seven others under various Sections of Indian Penal Code including 342 (wrongful confinement), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 302 (murder), 506 part I and II (criminal intimidation), and 201 (causing disappearance of evidence of offence).

Even as a special police team was in search of Kittappa, who was facing more than 25 cases against him, they received information that he, along with his associates ‘Left’ Murugan of Narasinganallur and Manikandan of Ramaiyanpatti, was hiding in a house under construction near Suththamalli intersection near here. When the police team, led by Inspector Krishnaraj, tried to nab the trio, the armed criminals allegedly launched an attack on the police and lobbed country-made bombs on the police vehicle.

As Sub-Inspector of Police Sivaramakrishnan and policemen Saravana Sundar and Krishnasamy reportedly sustained injuries in the attack, the police fired at Kittappa. He died on the spot, the police said.

Alleging that her husband was killed in a fake encounter, Kittappa’s wife Esakkiammal filed a case in the District Principal Sessions Court and Judge Nazir Ahmed on February 9 directed the CB-CID to register a case against 12 persons allegedly involved in the encounter.

Kittappa was allegedly involved in robbery, jail-break and five murder cases, the police said.

Criminal’s wife had arraigned two senior police officers in the case
title: CB-CID case against 12 in encounter case
